action.action-desc: Mr. Tony Gonzales of Texas (for himself, Mr. Langevin, and Mr. Bacon) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Adoption and Legal Guardianship Incentive Payment Program to promote reunifying families, community-based care, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Communities Advancing Reunification Efforts Act or the CARE Act.

section.header: Incentive payments to States for increasing successful reunifications of children with their families

subsection.text: Section 473A(d)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 673b(d)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and at the end of subparagraph (C);
by striking the period at the end of subparagraph (D) and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: $500, multiplied by the amount (if any) by which—

clause.text: the number of successful reunifications in the State during the fiscal year; exceeds
the number of successful reunifications in the State during the preceding fiscal year.

subsection.header: Limitation on use of incentive payment
subsection.text: Section 473A(f) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 673b(f)) is amended by striking (including post-adoption services) that may be provided under part B or E and inserting that may be provided under part B or E (including post-adoption services, and community-based, trauma-informed services to assist in reuniting and strengthening families).
Section 473A(g) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 673b(g)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term successful reunification means, with respect to a State and a fiscal year, the number of qualified children with respect to the State who—

subparagraph.text: in the preceding fiscal year, were reunified with their biological families in the State within 1 year after removal; and
have remained with their biological families, without re-entry into foster care, for at least 1 year after reunification.

paragraph.text: The term qualified child means, with respect to a State, a child—

subparagraph.text: who is not ineligible for foster care under the supervision of the State by reason of age; and
the parental rights with respect to whom have not been terminated.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect when the Secretary of Health and Human Services determines that the information needed to implement the amendments is available.
